Articles.Content:
I have a few beauty and info mods installed and the official asteroid day mod installed in my KSP directory. I was launching my Duna Station Hub and for some reason, the structural fuselage that held everything together blew up from overheating. Here are a few pics to give you a visualization.

> [Javascript is disabled. View full album](//imgur.com/a/h5gFH)

It's strange because the part that's exploding is blanketed in Radiators.

\*sherlock, a clue!\*

The part only overheats when I decouple the fairings.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-07-01T15:38:28Z" title="07/01/2015 03:38  PM" data-short="9 yr">July 1, 2015</time> by One-Way Films**
  
\*a clue!!\*

Radiators won't help with this bug, I tried everything. After I left the atmosphere the temperature on some parts shot up in the billions of degrees and spread to the whole ship. Only the cheat to ignore max temp allowed me to observe this. Check out this thread [http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/126664-MAJOR-Heating-Bug/page2](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/126664-MAJOR-Heating-Bug/page2)

I can confirm this. I'm using Kerbal Engineer to monitor which parts have max temp, but suddenly, a docking port here, a battery there, randomly started exploding due to them "overheating" even if they weren't the hottest parts according to KER. The new heating system has a mind of it's own and it's really frustrating.
Do you use FAR? I've got a similar issue and it just goes away after removing the mod.
